node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.alt: This building in East Flatbush contains 20 medical offices.
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.
node.content: ["$2.05 MILLION", "1414 Utica Avenue (between Foster Avenue and Farragut Road)", "Brooklyn", "This three-story, 10,083-square-foot office building in East Flatbush comes with a 3,000-square-foot vacant lot at 1376 Utica Avenue that is used for parking. Built in 1931, the building is occupied by Tri-Borough Home Care and contains 20 medical offices.", "Buyer: Mark Koplowitz", "Seller: Kenrick Cort", "Brokers: Greg Corbin and Chaya Milworn of Rosewood Realty Group", "$15 MILLION", "236 West 72nd Street (between Broadway and West End Avenue)", "Manhattan", "This six-story, 16,000-square-foot building on the Upper West Side was built in 1927 and was used for the past 48 years as a mission house and the New York headquarters for the Metropolitan New York Baptist Association. It has 10 commercial units and will be delivered vacant.", "Seller: N.Y. Baptist Mission", "Brokers: Adelaide Polsinelli and Meylin Maldonado of Compass", "$19.9 MILLION", "975 Liberty Avenue (between Chestnut Street and Conduit Boulevard)", "Brooklyn", "Built in 2018, this seven-story, 40,249-square-foot building in Cypress Hills includes 41 apartments, all occupied. Thirteen of the apartments are leased through a lottery run by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development. The building also has a parking lot and six leased commercial spaces on the ground floor and lower level, occupied by a home health care office, an optical store, an events space and several offices.", "Seller: Liberty for All", "Brokers: Stephen R. Preuss, Kevin Schmitz, Andreas Efthymiou and Kevin Louie of Ripco Real Estate"]
